reviews.sentence: The location and breakfastFor the price it was an okay room. We expected a bit nice.
Good thing there are so many other hotel options. Noise level was ridiculous. Front desk staff in the evening was neither helpful nor accommodating.

Hotel stay while visiting family. This hotel was quite disappointing. I thoroughly reviewed pictures and had taken note of customer reviews and was very disappointed upon arrival. The hotel was quite dated and the rooms did not seem to be clean. I could not wait to leave this place. location. cleanliness.

More average than it appears at first sight. This hotel is located in a region with a large number of successful companies including IT companies defense contractors and telecoms providers and from the outside looks the part large building prominent location and prices at the top end of the mid range hotel brands Mariot Hilton etc. It has a lot of amenities including a large lounge area off the main lobby with a bar and a small restaurant where they serve breakfast. It also has a business center fitness room and pool. Overall pretty much what what you might expect. I was disappointed with the charges for incidentals though 3 for a bottle of water provided in my room when many hotels will provide that for free these days room service charges that seemed much higher than normal for this grade of hotel 15 gratuity for a breakfast buffet that might be 10 in a lot of similar hotels. Also I arrived on a Sunday evening after a long drive only to find that the pool is only open for a few hours on a Sunday and closed at 60pm when I had been looking forward to a swim and maybe a soak in the hot tub to unwind. Looking in the hotel information I saw that the pool is only open on other days for relatively limited periods of time too when most hotels I use more typically have the pool open from early morning through to at least 100pm. I also discovered that the wall between my room and the one next to it was paper thin. I could hear conversations that the people next door were having and later that night when they were enjoying each others company so to speak it was so noisy that it kept me awake. The following morning I was woken up by the same people when I think someone jumped onto the bed it slammed into the wall and I actually felt my bed shake. I really do not think the people in the next room were actually being particularly noisy. it was just that the wall was so insubstantial. More what you had expect in a low budget motel than a brand like Hyat. Having made those comments overall the hotel was not terrible just less than I had expected given the location and the star rating. If you are there for work and you need to be close to one of the local companies it is probably a reasonable option but I would shop around and see what else is on offer before making the booking.

Not your average Hyat. This hotel is unlike any Hyat that I have stayed at. The hotel is old and dated. Hallways have the worst color scheme which makes you feel like your walking through some type of hospital or institution. The room smelled of smoke and looked dingy. Our bed did not have a fitted sheet only a top sheet which was odd to me. The breakfast selection was limited. You have to pay for coffee but all the other juices were free. The staff in the kitchen were not very friendly and asked for tips during our continental breakfast. This place is more like a holiday inn not Hyat.

My daughter ended up with bed bug bites. My daughter ended up with bed bug bites. We complained to the hotel who took 3 weeks to get back to us. They then denied there was a problem despite us providing pictures of her bites and a doctors note. Terrible hotel.

3 star disguised as 4. The rooms are in serious need of a renovations. Looks like a Hyat until u get inside. The hallways looks like 3 star or even 2 star wall paper is well worn. There is also a strong smelnot the good kind that continues into the room that smells like strong freshener. The place just does not feel comfortable. Also annoying is that we booked for 3 adults and 1 child and they could not find us a room with 2 double beds and could only offer a king bed with a pull out sofa bed. We checked 4 pm so I can not believe they are out of rooms. The reason I was given is the they have a wedding and are full but that should not be my problem. The pool is decent with a few toys for kids that is a nice touch. Front desk service is what u would expect except the roller bed they promised never came. Tv is pixelated like low resolution and in this day and age it is unacceptable. Wifi is free but slow kind. Like 2 3mbs. You have to pay more for faster internet. In conclusion do not expect a 4 star experience. This is a old 3 star hotel if you ask me.

Hyat Regency average. Hyat Regency standards are not in effect at this hotel. It felt like a franchise property using the Hyat name. Hotel entrance poorly marked no bell service and we were left to fend for ourselves. Bath tub shower do not have grab bars. In addition the anti skid material on the bottom was worn away leaving the impression of something there but in fact very slippery. Strange sounds coming from sink requiring putting a towel in the basin to dampen the sound. Rooms and hotel were in good condition. We were here for a conference and there was a mixup with double booking with another group. The food was average at the banquet dinner. Edible but not memorable. Cookies are not worth eating.

The address is correct on their website. The room had damaged walls and whal looked like mold in the shower vent. Even though the room was paid they preauthorized 40 on my credit card. That is offensive on principle. The internet sped is quite slow. The pillows are also too soft.

Nice hotel great staff. I booked at the Hyat Regency Fairfax on a staycation for my birthday and was instantly upgraded to a suite which was a great way to start my stay. The room was at the end of the hotel which has a cool wrap around window providing a unique room shape that I really enjoyed. The lobby faces the restaurant bar area which has a nice open plan and a very high ceiling creating a sense of grandeur that most hotels in this 3 class do not have. The beds were very comfy and had ample down pillows. Soaps and other such amenities were from KenetMD very nice. Shower had excellent water pressure and the room itself was immaculately clean. There was a safe iron ironing board and a fridge stocked with the usual beverages. The WiFi was 100 free in rooms and it worked great. They do have an ultra high speed option for 5 for business travelers who need better download speeds which is totally reasonable but the average person will do just fine with the free service. There are plenty of stores and food within walking distance although nothing too fancy. The area itself is peaceful and well presented. What really stood out was the staff particularly Bianca at the front desk. She is awesome. I felt like a family guest because of her warm service. I checked in at 3 pm and came down to the lobby at around 1030 and Bianca was still there. It was amazing that she remembered me after checking in people for hours on end and gave me a little birthday treat on the house. that is the kind of thing that ensures a return visit. If I had to suggest a couple of improvements1. The entrance is odd. it is very narrow and the passageway from the door to the front desk passes by the elevators on the way making for an awkward colliding of guests in the cramped hallway. There was no doorman or anyone at all by the front door to welcome guests to the hotel. Not the best first impresion2. The spa was out of order while I was there spa being the hot tub. I spoke to the lifeguard and it had been out of order for over a week. I love a good hot tub dip when I stay at hotels and so it was disappointing that they had neglected to fix an advertised amenity for so long3. There were a relatively small offering of channels on the TV and the first few were so fuzzy they were pretty un watchable. Very non HD in general felt like a 1990s TV experience. In general it was a very good experience and I would return to this hotel without hesitation.

Good Hotel With Hyat Rerency Standard. Front desk staff was excellent you can get drinks or bit as any time. Room are big and clean breakfast was excellent. Location is bit out but can walk to nearby if you really need for lunch or dinner the bar at lobby also good. Ask for kettle and just 1 minute send to room even room provided coffee machine nor far from washing DC with direct highway direct to city WDCWel done the team of this hotel always look forward to return.

Great value Great stay RR in Fairfax. The Hyat Regency Fairfax is an older property but appears updated and is well maintained. My room was a panoramic queen that is a corner end room so it was spacious quiet and half of the room was windows with a truly panoramic breathtaking view. If you are traveling with more than one person or you like a larger room for a little more RR. the upgrade is well worth it. While some of the other reviewers mentioned thin walls and noise I had no such experience here. The front desk staff was courteous and pleasant. They were also well equipped and able accommodate large groups I noticed a number of buses when I returned to the hotel. As far as location the Hyat Regency Fairfax is nestled in a quiet office campus multifamily setting with mature trees and greenery but centrally located to at least two newer retail areas in either direction of the hotel. The only issues that I had were that the elevators were a bit slow and that the food specifically the breakfast buffet was only so. so I had just order off the menu next time. All in all a solid stay that I will repeat next time I am in the area.
The room was nice and clean. The bed was comfortable. I like how the television swirved from the sitting area to the bedroom. Nice exercise room. Free parking a plus. No.

Hardman Whit Moore Mays Heart Family Renunion. The staff was one of the very professional and accommodating that I have had the pleasure of dealing with in my travel. The front desk staff were always full of smiles and cheer regardless of the time of day evening or night. At the same time they were always about the business at hand. They were also timely in moving the masses of our family through the check in and check out process. The only suggestion that I would make is that throughout their interaction they continue to make eye contact. The rooms and hotel were clean and I give them five stars for food service as well. I will come back to this oasis in Fairfax over and over again.
We loved the spaciousness of the room and the separate seating area as well as the cleanliness. I loved everything.

Location is great. It is nearby food and convenient stores. Breakfast was alright. The interior is pretty and offers a beat and grill. did not like that parking was 8 but parking lot has no markings on ground and no security. The room was modern and clean. Location is great. It is nearby food and convenient stores. Breakfast was alright. The interior is pretty and offers a beat and grill. did not like that parking was 8 but parking lot has no markings on ground and no security. The room was modern and clean.

Great hotel great staff great location. Welcoming and friendly staff. Clean rooms. Excellent location close to major freeways airport restaurants CVS and Whole Foods. Rooms are spacious. Good gym with clean equipment and indoor swimming pool. Spacious and convenient parking lot with fees much less than DC.

Great Room. Would stay again. Looked for something that was close to the office for our business and it worked out perfect. I would definitely recommend this to others and relay the comfort and cleanslines of the room.

Stayed here while visiting family over Thanksgiving. We were upgraded at check in without our asking—“just because”—and the room was superb. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful despite having to work over the holiday. This is our new go to hotel in the area. We will absolutely return. Thank you.

How good is the Hyat Fairfax. Excellent — especially the price point. The beds are extremely comfortable beautiful lobby and very helpful staff. It is my favorite place to stay when I am in the DC area conveniently located right off 66 with free parking.
